A high quality self-directed support service for all disability groups (physical disabilities, sensory impairment, learning disabilities, parents of children and young people, users of mental health services, older people and carers).
Offers a range of services shaped around what service users are asking for. Empowers individuals to make choices in the way their care and support is delivered. The service is free to people eligible to access the support service via the local authority support service contract. Have developed an extensive list of services for people who wish to access services privately. This is particularly helpful for people who have an assessment resulting in an indicative budget and support plan who would not be eligible to access support via the contracted support service.
Offers advice and support to people who receive direct payments. Helps individuals to manage their care budget. Will also recruit a personal assistant and employ a personal assistant.
